title: Drawing, "Design for a Tureen and a Platter", 1740–48
medium: Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash on two joined sheets of paper
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Tureen in elevation, platter in plan.  The left and right halves of the tureen body are slightly different, as alternative designs. Crowned escutcheon in center of body.  Various plants and crayfish form knop.

exhibitions.title: The Huguenot Legacy: English Silver, 1680-1760 from the Alan & Simone Hartman Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Tureen and a Platter", 1740–48.
1740–48. Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash on two joined sheets of paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-160-a.
